bug.author: jlewi
bug.summary: presubmit failures; required node image not available
bug.description:
/kind bug I'm seeing presubmit failures on PR: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/3824>#3824</denchmark-link> . This PR is just updating the ROADMAP so unlikely related to that PR. The failure I'm seeing is <denchmark-code>util.py 71 INFO time="2019-08-13T13:14:28Z" level=error msg="Creating kfctl-46c6 error: &{Code:RESOURCE_ERROR Location:/deployment s/kfctl-46c6/resources/kfctl-46c6 Message:{\"ResourceType\":\"gcp-types/container-v1beta1:projects.locations.clusters\",\"ResourceErrorCode\":\"400\",\"Re sourceErrorMessage\":{\"code\":400,\"message\":\"The required node image is not available.\",\"status\":\"INVALID_ARGUMENT\",\"statusMessage\":\"Bad Reque st\",\"requestPath\":\"https://container.googleapis.com/v1beta1/projects/kubeflow-ci-deployment/locations/us-east1-d/clusters\",\"httpMethod\":\"POST\"}} ForceSendFields:[] NullFields:[]}" filename="gcp/gcp.go:348" util.py 71 INFO Error: couldn't apply KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: coordinator Apply failed for gcp: (kubeflo w.error): Code 400 with message: gcp apply could not update deployment manager Error could not update deployment manager entries; Creating kfctl-46c6 erro r(400): BAD REQUEST </denchmark-code>
spyglass <denchmark-link:https://prow.k8s.io/view/gcs/kubernetes-jenkins/pr-logs/pull/kubeflow_kubeflow/3824/kubeflow-presubmit/1161261200583954437/>link</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.97. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
Someone is hitting a similar error trying to customize their GKE deployment <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/website/issues/1065>kubeflow/website#1065</denchmark-link>

The error The required node image is not available should indicate cluster creation failed because we are trying to use a VM image which doesn't exist. I'm not sure why we would get that error though because I don't think we try to explicitly set the image.

API reference for NodeConfig <denchmark-link:https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/reference/rest/v1beta1/NodeConfig>https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/reference/rest/v1beta1/NodeConfig</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code>gcloud --project=kubeflow-ci-deployment container get-server-config --zone=us-east1-d Fetching server config for us-east1-d defaultClusterVersion: 1.12.8-gke.10 defaultImageType: COS validImageTypes: - COS - UBUNTU - COS_CONTAINERD - UBUNTU_CONTAINERD - WINDOWS_SAC validMasterVersions: - 1.13.7-gke.19 - 1.13.7-gke.8 - 1.13.6-gke.13 - 1.12.9-gke.13 - 1.12.9-gke.7 - 1.12.8-gke.12 - 1.12.8-gke.10 - 1.12.7-gke.26 - 1.12.7-gke.25 - 1.11.10-gke.6
</denchmark-code>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link>
One observation: It is happening only for us-east1-d zone when tried with CLI. Works fine for us-central1-a GKE bug?
I am experiencing a similar issue in europe-west3. Trying to create with "COS".
Experiencing the same issue with image type UBUNTU in europe-west2-a. Any known workarounds?
Encountering the same issue even when attempting to create a cluster via GCP UI, so I'd say it's unrelated to kubeflow or the terraform provider.
Thanks I'll try moving our tests to us-central1-a
looks like it works now with us-east1-d
